article.title: Raytheon Wins Air Force Radar Receiver Contract
article.author: Henry Kenyon
article.text: The U.S. Air Force has awarded Raytheon CompanyÂ a $19.8 million contract to continue production of ALR-69A(V) radar warning receiver systems for the Warner Robins Air Logistics Center, Robins Air Force Base, Georgia. Under the contract, the company will manufacture and test 34 of the digital receivers under the low-rate initial production program. Deliveries are scheduled to begin in March 2011 and end in June 2012.
